channel.title: SN to Rockbot Video Feed
channel.description: A collection of video content from Spirits Network.

item.title: Barrel Select: Maker's Mark
item.description: When the Black Bourbon Society gets involved in a Maker's Mark Private Selection something special always happens. Join Armond and Samara Davis' journey to create their latest unique bourbon, created with Maker's newest stave, Roasted French Mendiant. This whisky was not only highly anticipated and limited, it took less than 72 hours to sell out

item.title: Barrel Select: Borders
item.description: Cask Program at The Borders Distillery, an opportunity to own and mature your own cask of whisky is ever rarer! Join award winning spirits journalists Brad Japhe and Becky Paskin as they head to the Borders region to sample the first whisky to come out of there in 200 years.

item.title: Bourbon Barter: One man, 180 miles
item.description: One man, 180 miles, and a sh*tload of Bourbon. Adam Carolla hits the Kentucky Bourbon Trail with cases of Bulleit as his only currency in part one of Bourbon Barter. With a 25-mile limit to each deal, things get interesting for Carolla along the way, which tends to happen when Lamborghinis, corn fields, and a Tempur Pedic showroom are thrown into the mix. Stay tuned to see if he makes it to the finish line.

item.title: Bourbon Barter: Unexpected Trades
item.description: Day two of Adam Carolla's Kentucky Bourbon Trail adventure brings some...unexpected trades. From a gigantic mural of his own face to some prized historic turds (there's no time to explain), the barters get more and more interesting as the final destination draws nearer.

item.title: Bourbon Barter: The Home Stretch
item.description: In the third and final Bourbon Barter episode, Adam Carolla makes his way through the home stretch of the Kentucky Bourbon Trail, encountering a few interesting (and rather important) characters along the way. Will he make it past the finish line in time to catch ZZ Top at the Bourbon and Beyond festival? There's only one way to find out.

item.title: Celebration Libations: My Blue Valentine
item.description: Be inspired by the legends of the bartending community as they bring you elevated seasonal drink recipes for every occasion. With Valentine's Day around the corner, Thomas Holbert AKA Tommy the Bartender has got you covered with a romantic and unexpected Johnnie Walker Blue Label cocktail that will dazzly your Valentine. Join Tommy as he makes his inspired cocktail for his sweetheart, Sandra.

item.title: Celebration Libations: Strong Knows Strong
item.description: Celebrate the strong women in your life this Women’s Month with a great cocktail. Mixologist Alli Torres is joined by Julie Reiner as she mixes up Julie’s recipe for Strong Knows Strong with Johnnie Walker Black Label.

item.title: Celebration Libations: The Valarie
item.description: This Mother’s Day celebrate mom with a fantastic cocktail using Johnnie Walker High Rye. Mixologist Karl Franz Williams is joined at the bar by the love of his life and mother of his children. He’ll craft her a custom cocktail and teach you how to recreate it at home.

item.title: Celebration Libations: Old Story Long
item.description: Join celebrated Ukrainian mixologist Dmytro Shovkoplias as he crafts a custom Father’s Day cocktail for one of the world’s foremost authorities on spirits, Flavien Desoblin using Johnnie Walker Blue Label.

item.title: Cellar Sessions: Mi Familia es tu Familia
item.description: Spirits Expert Elayne Duff cracks open three bottles from the Jose Cuervo Reserva De La Familia portfolio with acclaimed spirits writer Tony Sachs and author Kurt Maitland. Curious drinkers everywhere can enjoy this fly on the wall discussion on agave, aging and their intimate experiences from careers in this alluring industry.

item.title: Cellar Sessions: Innovation & Identity
item.description: Join Elayne and her worldly friends, Global Food Expert Nilou Motamed and Proximo Spirits Agave Advocacy Lead, Jaime Salas as they enjoy the world's first pechuga tequila and a spirited dialogue about staying true to yourself.

item.title: Cellar Sessions: Collaboration and Celebration
item.description: Elayne Duff is joined by fellow agave lovers Nilou Motamed and Jaime Salas as they reunite to taste three amazing bottles of Maestro Dobel tequila and talk growth, collaboration, and celebrating your personal victories.

item.title: Cocktail History: Old Fashioned
item.description: Was the first Singapore Sling made in Southeast Asia? What does the Margarita have to do with a famous jazz musician? We’re telling the historical tales of the world’s most iconic and inventive cocktails. In the premiere episode, discover the facts and folklore of the most customizable concoction, The Old Fashioned. From the first bottled bourbon in Louisville to the hotel bars of New York City, The Old Fashioned has a worldly upbringing that’s as old as the word “cocktail”.

item.title: Cocktail History: Dark 'n Stormy
item.description: Sometimes the origin story of a cocktail is as clear as a bright Bermuda day. In this episode of Cocktail History, discover how a sailing mishap back in 1806 ultimately brought about the creation of the Dark ‘n Stormy®.

item.title: First Taste: Mountain Angel
item.description: First Kiss. First car. First home. You always remember your first, and spirits are no exception. That first time a new dram hits your lips can change your life, and we’re bottling this experience in First Taste. Join spirits experts Aaron Goldfarb, Elayne Duff and Kurt Maitland try Mountain Angel, the first 10 year old American straight single malt, an exclusive new release from legendary American distillery, Stranahan's Colorado Whiskey, to see if it's love at first sip.

item.title: Grillin It: Sour And Spice Makes BBQ Nice
item.description: Thyme is on your side when you’re mixing up Samara Davis’s twist on a whisky sour, with thyme infused simple syrup and a touch of cracked pepper, this cocktail pairs perfectly with Pitmaster, Bryan Furman’s Lemon Pepper Chicken.

item.title: Grillin It: A Peachy Kean BBQ
item.description: What’s in Pitmaster Bryan Furman’s secret Peach Mustard sauce? How about some peated scotch to elevate his smokey ribs. Wash it all down with Samara Davis’s “not so” Old Fashioned and you'll be living in backyard bliss.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: No Half Assed Mules
item.description: Check out liquid chef Rob Floyd as he gives the traditional Moscow Mule “a kick” with 3 different variations you won’t want to miss. You'll need vodka, gin, and whiskey to make the drinks along with Rob. If you don’t have them on hand, order it now.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Staycation Margatias
item.description: If you’re dreaming of some sand between your toes and a cold drink in your hand, then tune in to see Liquid Chef Rob Floyd head south of the border to put a unique twist on everyone’s favorite poolside cocktail...the margarita!

item.title: Home Bar Hero: World of Rye
item.description: This week on Home Bar Hero, we're going deep into the world of rye. Whether you're a fan of the classic Manhattan or into something far from 'Old Fashioned,' you're not going to want to miss Liquid Chef Rob Floyd as he cracks open a bottle of WhistlePig Whiskey and mixes up 4 cocktails that showcase the unexpected versatility of this spirit.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Confiscated
item.description: On this week's Home Bar Hero Liquid Chef Rob Floyd seized control of our taste buds with a few great cocktails designed to steal the show using Kentucky Owl Confiscated Bourbon Whiskey.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Quarantinis
item.description: This week on #HomeBarHero, Liquid Chef Rob Floyd is teaming up with Maxim to take stay-at-home orders for drinks that buzz, float and bubble to make your time inside a bit more exciting. We’re calling them “Quarantinis” and they are the perfect way to spice up any shelter in place.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Anagram Cocktails
item.description: This week on Home Bar hero, we’re mixing it up with Liquid Chef Rob Floyd and Glenmorangie … Literally. We’re talking “anagram cocktails,” innovative drinks with names using the letters G-L-E-N-M-O-R-A-N-G-I-E. If you’ve ever wanted to sip “A Ginger Lemon” or a “Gleaming Reno”, this is your chance, so don’t miss out, because everyone loves a little wordplay with their whisky.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Summer Sippers
item.description: You don’t want to miss Liquid Chef Rob Floyd as he mixes up some summertime sippers that are sure to help you soak up the sun in style. Whether you’re poolside or hitting the beach, these are the cocktails you need in your hand when your feet are in the sand.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: LoCal Cocktails
item.description: You don't have to go far to enjoy #HomeBarHero tonight, as Liquid Chef Rob Floyd is keeping it LoCal. No, that's not a typo. We're talking low-calorie drinks using locally sourced ingredients that taste great without the weight. Tune in to keep that beach bod rolling into sweater season.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Tailgate
item.description: Play ball! Now that sports are back in full swing, Home Bar Hero is ready to take the field and show you how to mix some pre-game cocktails that will give you the home team advantage for every game.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Top Shelf Cocktails
item.description: Home Bar Hero is going to be a "grand" old time tonight as Liquid Chef Rob Floyd brings some cocktails to the top shelf with the immaculate Grand Marnier. From smokey Negronis to bubbly Palomas, you need to see how a little orange-flavored liqueur can elevate these classic cocktails to a whole new level.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Tis the Season
item.description: Liquid Chef Rob Floyd is back for your holiday cocktail inspiration as he tests out some special recipes from The Cocktail Project to get you ready for your intimate gatherings this season.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Home For The Holidays
item.description: This week, its all about turning your quiet evenings at home into a celebration worthy of saying goodbye to 2020 with recipe inspiration from The Cocktail Project.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: 2021 New Year Celebration
item.description: Ring in the new year with Liquid Chef Rob Floyd as he mixes up an insanely delicious cocktail using Stranahan's Blue Peak Whiskey.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Derby Edition
item.description: Watch this episode of Home Bar Hero, Derby edition with Rob Floyd as he demonstrates some of the traditional cocktails associated with the two-day event, such as the the Woodford Spire - a refreshing mix that uses Woodford Reserve Straight Bourbon Whiskey; the Finlandia Oaks Lily- a light, refreshing drink crafted from a base of Finlandia Vodka; and no Derby is complete without an Old Forester Mint Julep.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Dads Drinking Rum
item.description: Rob Floyd is joined behind the bar by John from @dadsdrinkingbourbon for this special holiday episode. Can he convince this bourbon lover to drink rum this holiday season?

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Some Love For 2022
item.description: The new year is upon us and Rob is here to show you how to make the perfect NYE cocktail with special guest Nashville blogger and fashionista, Leigh Love, to mix things up in style.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Stress Free Summer
item.description: The weather is heating up, which means it’s the perfect time to serve some refreshing summer cocktails for your friends and family. Join Rob behind the bar as he shows us how to make three amazing and stress free drinks with Ramazzotti Aperitivo Rosato.

item.title: Home Bar Hero: Calling All Whiskymakers
item.description: Join Rob Floyd in the studio as he mixes up some delicious Compass Box Scotch Whisky cocktails with three incredible bottles Orchard House, Artist Blend, and The Peat Monster. Inspired by Compass Box’s inventive and experimental whisky making, Rob shares two imaginative fruit forward cocktails, takes on a modern classic, and shows you how to mix a three ingredient drink that will delight your guests.

item.title: House of Flavour: Unctuous Juicy Boy
item.description: Get your palate ready for a burst of delicious knowledge when Britain's master mixologist Jack Sotti and Michelin star chef Paul Lobban nerd out on the perfect pairing; a “T10 Sea Highball” with succulent oysters and black mushroom licorice!

item.title: House of Flavour: You Complete Me
item.description: Britain's master mixologist Jack Sotti is back to riff on complementary and contrasting flavors with Michelin star chef Paul Lobban as they simplify the seemingly complex process of lactose fermentation to create a Tanqueray Rangpur Lime “Blackberry & Pine Highball” paired with cod roe waffles.

item.title: House of Flavour: Lobster
item.description: Master mixologist Jack Sotti and Michelin star chef Paul Lobban team up to put a twist on the classic Ramos Gin Fizz and pair it with lobster and fiery xo sauce.

item.title: Magic of Mezcal: Ghost Donkey
item.description: Join Montelobos Mezcal's Camille Austin and legendary bartender Nacho Jimenez for a round inside New York City's favorite agave spirits den, Ghost Donkey (where time has a way of stopping while you sip). Salud!

item.title: Magic of Mezcal: Claro
item.description: Trek to Brooklyn, NY with La Loba Mezcalera, Camille Austin, to scope out Claro's extraordinary mezcal pairings. Let's just say they're on fire.

item.title: Magic of Mezcal: La Contenta
item.description: La Loba Mezcalera visits La Contenta in Manhattan to teach us about Mezcal, its history, and the traditional way to taste it. Join Camille and her friend Kat as they learn to mix La Contenta's signature cocktail: The Oaxaca Express.

item.title: Meet the Masters: Richard Paterson
item.description: An enlightening moment with renowned Master Distiller Richard Paterson Host: Richard Patterson

item.title: Meet the Masters: Enrique de Colsa
item.description: Learn the five steps of Tequila making with Don Julio Master Distiller Enrique de Colsa in this episode of Meet the Masters, an ode to agave country through the eyes of a true veteran. Host: Enrique de Colsa

item.title: Meet the Masters: Bill Lumsden
item.description: Dr. Bill Lumsden takes us through an eye opening exploration into his love for single malts and what makes Glenmorangie's newest release, "A Tale Of Cake" so special.

item.title: Meet the Masters: Bertha González Nieves
item.description: Discover how a passion for the agave plant, a love of Mexican culture and a pioneering spirit to innovate helped Bertha González Nieves, Co-founder & CEO of Casa Dragones, create some of the world’s finest Tequila.

item.title: Mix & Flix: Mexico
item.description: Underwater artist Julie Gautier on finding the soul of dance in Mexico’s cenotes.

item.title: Mix & Flix: Japan
item.description: Artist Fidan Bagirova unearths inspiration through a Japanese tradition.

item.title: Mix & Flix: Spain
item.description: Artist Felix Semper reconnects with his roots in Spain.

item.title: Off the Shelf: Robert Simmons
item.description: Clay Risen sits down with martini master Robert Simonson to discuss the ins and outs of the cocktail world's grand classics, regional drinking, and terrible puns.

item.title: Off the Shelf: Aaron Goldfarb
item.description: Drinks journalist and author Aaron Goldfarb sits down to chat bone marrow infusing, holiday cocktails (think aged eggnog), and one of his latest books, Hacking Whiskey. After a few drinks, the ink blots and Jägermeister come out, and things inevitably get weird.

item.title: Off the Shelf: Amanda Schuster
item.description: It's Taboo time with Clay Risen and guest Amanda Schuster, journalist and author of New York Cocktails. Get ready for some fun and games (and Amanda's worst nightmare, a shaken Manhattan).

item.title: Peggy Noes Best: Batch Cocktail
item.description: Learn about all things batched cocktails with serial spirits entertainer Peggy Noe Stevens and guest Nicole Stipp, President of Matson & Gilman. Large format whiskey cocktails coming right up.

item.title: Peggy Noes Best: Host for the Holidays
item.description: Serial spirits entertainer Peggy Noe Stevens is in full holiday mode in this episode of Peggy Noes Best. Serving a whiskey punch at your seasonal functions never got easier––just add cranberries.

item.title: Peggy Noes Best: Make your Home Bar the Star
item.description: Peggy Noe Stevens teaches us a lesson on what it takes to set up your ultimate home bar in a spirited edition of Peggy Noes Best.

item.title: Peggy Noes Best: Hosting a Tasting
item.description: The goal of tasting whiskey is to enjoy the spirit in a way that is meaningful to you; Peggy opens up our palates in this edition of Peggy Noes Best: Hosting a Tasting.

item.title: Raising the Bar: Making Spirits Bright
item.description: Our hosts are Raising the Bar this holiday season sharing their expert insights on curating the perfect serve and mastering the art of hosting your holiday parties. Join them in helping musical guest, Ryan Cabrera, celebrate the season with more meaningful bottles, intimate tastings and a signature cocktail, the Chivas Gold Rush.

item.title: Raising the Bar: Holiday Swag
item.description: Discover how to tailor your holiday gift list with bottles that resonate with thoughtfulness and authenticity. Our expert hosts are joined by NYC’s most relatable and culturally infused personalities in the digital content industry, Swaggy Sie. Watch her learn to serve a Glenlivet Royale and sip along for a game of “Sip, Gift, or Save”.

item.title: Science of Spirits: KyMar
item.description: Journey to upstate New York with host Flavien Desoblin, to learn the science behind a unique malt whiskey distillery.

item.title: Science of Spirits: Waterford
item.description: Join spirits enthusiast Segun Oduolowu as he traverses the rolling hills of South East Ireland to discover the magic and natural methodologies behind Waterford Whisky. There, Segun learns firsthand about Waterford’s terroir project from the biodynamic growers, terroir specialists, and passionate distillers who brought the program to life.

item.title: Sip In The City: NYC Rooftop Refreshments
item.description: As the summer commences across the US, happy hour is essential, but finding cocktail inspiration isn't always easy. In this fun twist on DIY cocktail tutorials, Liquid Chef Rob Floyd brings his charisma and expertise to a rooftop bar in New York where he will show us how to create breathtaking cocktails for every occasion, highlighting Musgrave Gin in short, high-energy segments.

item.title: The Sipping Point: New Orleans
item.description: Join Aaron Goldfarb and Brad Japhe after-hours in New Orleans for a nightcap with Martell cognacs and Jefferson's whiskies. Touré Folkes, founder of Turning Tables, drops by with some po-boy sandwiches and mixologist, Jack Schramm, whisks up some Sazeracs to complete their night in the Big Easy.

item.title: The Sipping Point: Wilderness Trail
item.description: After going "off-trail" from their tour guide, spirits writers Brad Japhe and Aaron Goldfarb find themselves on the ultimate private tour of Wilderness Trail Distillery. Their curiosity is rewarded when Wilderness Trail Distillery co-founder Dr. Pat Heist, PHD shares a behind the scenes look at the lab, rickhouse, and visitor’s center. Along the way, they’ll taste any array of Wilderness Trail Whiskey, from new make to special releases.

item.title: Story of the Spirits: Goslings
item.description: Stormy seas make for smooth spirts and Goslings has a distinctive new expression of their blended rum to prove it. Join Tommy the Bartender as he makes his way to Bermuda to meet the people behind the bottle, gets a taste of island life, and discovers the fascinating journey of Spirited Seas.

item.title: Story of the Spirits: Famous Grouse
item.description: Tommy heads to Scotland to discover all that goes into crafting The Famous Grouse whisky. There, he learns about their meticulous blending process and quality control and why this spirit has been the country’s favorite for over a century.

item.title: Take Out: Los Angeles
item.description: The new best night out is redefined with food influencer Corey Marshall, @MissFoodieProblems, as she gives us the insider's guide to pairing convenience, canned cocktails, and good cuisine. Comfort has never felt so good in the premiere episode of Take Out, when Corey orders in from one of the best Southeast Asian restaurants in Los Angeles, Bone Kettle, and pairs it with a Cutwater™s Rum Tiki Mai Tai canned cocktail for the easiest, most delicious night in.

item.title: Tales From The Cask: The Spirit of Don Julio
item.description: The Spirit of Don Julio: Get an exclusive inside look at the legendary Don Julio Distillery and learn the art and history behind the tequila from Master Distiller Enrique De Colsa himself. We go on a journey takes takes us through the tequila making process from cultivation all the way to distillation and along the way we interview passionate people from all walks of life that have helped shape the legacy of Don Julio.

item.title: United States of Spirits: Whisky Pairings, New York
item.description: There's so much to discover when it comes to New York City's bar and restaurant scene. That's why we've enlisted food, drink, and city life expert Marisel Salazar to take us on a Johnnie Walker-fueled journey through Brooklyn and Manhattan, where together we discover some of the best pairings in the boroughs.

item.title: Cardi's Whipshots: Cocktails with Cardi
item.description: Cocktails with Cardi put the bouchey in your boozey creations. Rob and Cardi are back, mixing up some mind blowing drinks topped with the coolest new ingredient, Whipshots.

item.title: Cardi's Whipshots: Holiday WhipShots
item.description: Cardi B is in this house! Cardi joins Rob Floyd behind the bar to whip up some special holiday drinks with her new exclusive Whipshots.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Affordable Single Malts
item.description: This week, we'll be tasting three delicious, complex and sophisticated single malts that won't break the bank. It's the whisky lovers event you won't want to miss.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Whisky Is Coming
item.description: On this week's #whiskywednesdays, we're sampling Game of Thrones themed single malts to see which one deserves a seat on the iron throne in your bar.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Peat, Smoke and a Lack Thereof
item.description: For peat’s sake! On this week's #WhiskyWednesdays, we're getting bogged down in the details of whiskies known for their peatiness. Whether you love some earthiness or think its for the worms, this is the episode you don’t want to miss.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Best In Class
item.description: This week on #WhiskyWednesdays, we've got no time for second place as we celebrate Flavien's favorite single malts in their respective class. From the best Speyside, (Cragganmore 12), to the Best 15 YR (The Singleton 15YR) to the best young malt (Lagavulin 8YR), we're crowning our whisky champions. So order your bottles now and meet us in the winner's circle.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Penny For Your Thoughts
item.description: This week on #WhiskyWednesdays, we’re kicking in our two cents on the importance of copper in distillation. From sulfur removal to heat conduction, we’ll be nerding out to explain why it's so damn important in giving whisky it’s bold flavors.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Knock On Wood
item.description: This week on #WhiskyWednesdays, we’re going out on a limb to talk about the importance of oak barrels. From maturation styles to cask sizes, we’ll be covering every aspect of the aging process and tasting some top notch single malts that you're sure to love.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Sound The Bell
item.description: This week on #WhiskyWednesdays, we’re going back to school to learn how a single malt is made, but if you think this is going to be a boring lecture, think again. We’ll be uncorking three A+ single malts that each get their unique character from the whisky making process.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: The Battle Isn't Over Yet
item.description: The saga continues this week on #WhiskyWednesdays as we taste another round of single malts from the Game of Thrones Collection. So break out your chalice and get ready to taste some amazing whisky.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Distiller's Edition
item.description: This week on #WhiskyWednesdays, we’re enjoying a nice wine, though not as you might think. We’re talking single malts finished in fortified wine casks. These special batches, known as Distiller’s Editions, all have their own unique flavor so tune in to see how a little sherry brings them to a whole new level.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Father's Day Pairings
item.description: Buon appetito! This week, #WhiskyWednesdays is back and hungrier than ever as we're sitting down with guest chef Giamie Mauri to identify what you can pair with The Classic Malts Strong Collection to bring your #FathersDay meal to Michelin star levels.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Age Is Just A Number
item.description: Age is just a number...unless you’re talking about single malts. A couple extra years in the barrel can make a huge difference in the flavor (and the price) of your favorite whisky. Join us this week as we explore the different marks of The Singleton of Glendullan to see just how important those age statements are.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Calling All Carnivores
item.description: This week, #WhiskyWednesdays is going to be a well done, rare treat as we're telling you the best cuts of meat to enjoy with the different age statements of Lagavulin. We'll be joined by spirits author Kurt Maitland as we slice down the best options for which slab should be on your plate when this smokey Islay staple starts flowing.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: The One True King
item.description: This week on #WhiskyWednesdays, the one true king won’t be Bran, but it will be dram, as we do battle one last time with the Game of Thrones single malt collection. Tune in to see which scotch deserves a seat upon the Iron Throne.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: The World Is Your Oyster
item.description: This week on #WhiskyWednesdays, the world is your oyster as we're diving into the world of Talisker. This famed seaside distillery is the birthplace to some of the world's finest whisky, which we'll be slurping with Oystertainer Sidney Boria of Red Oyster USA and Talisker distillery manager Diane Farrell.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: A Rare Treat
item.description: #WhiskyWednesdays is back and more festive than ever as Flavien Desoblin fills his stocking with some rare, cask strength single malts from Scotland’s most beloved distilleries.The Singleton of Dufftown 17 yrs, Lagavulan 12 yrs, Talisker 8yrs

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Elizabeth Karmel
item.description: This #WhiskyWednesday, we're letting you in on a secret...for the first time, we reveal what our Spirits Network Bottle Of the Month members have been drinking! Tune in for a tasting of some very unique bottles and delicious food pairings with Elizabeth Karmel, Founding Executive Chef of Hill Country BBQ Market. Its a palate pleasure you won't want to miss!

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Heather Dolland Tanem
item.description: There’s nothing more complimentary to a change of season, than the right spirit! Check out our April Bottle of the Month selections to see what Spirits Network members are enjoying this spring...and what our guest, Heather Dolland Tamem, Author of "Discovering the New York Spirits Boom" thinks about them.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Tequila Takeover
item.description: This week, we are having a TEQUILA TAKEOVER! That’s right, the magical agave spirit is hijacking our #WhiskyWednesdays so we can show you what our Spirits Network Agave members have been enjoying these last few months. Guest appearance by Ivy Mix, owner of Leyenda.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Elizabeth Karmel Returns
item.description: Make sure you “treat” yourself right! For our May Bottle of the Month members, we invite Chef Elizabeth Karmel, author of the amazing cookbook “Steak and Cake”, to pair our selections with some of your favorite desserts.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Tequla Takeover - Casa Dragones Anejo Barrel Blend
item.description: Bertha González Nieves, the first female Maestra Tequilera and the CEO and Co-Founder of Casa Dragones joins Flavien on today's #WhiskyWednesdays TEQUILA TAKEOVER! to sip Casa Dragones' new aged expression, Anejo Barrel Blend

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: On Location w/ Royal Salute
item.description: Come to Polo's biggest event of the year, stay for Flavien's tasting of some rare and exquisite whisky. Royal Salute Estancia stars in this special edition of #Whisky Wednesdays On Location with a guest appearance by famed whisky journalist, Aaron Goldfarb.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Rum Takeover (Neo and Santa Teresa)
item.description: Whisky’s wilder, less talked about spirit sister, Rum takes a front seat on this Rum Takeover. Two of the most creative mixologists in the game - Ivy Mix and Karl Williams join for .

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: It "Rums" in the Family
item.description: It “Rums” in the family this holiday season when host Flavien Desoblin dives into two special bottles of sipping rum that shouldn’t be missed!

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Spirit of Father's Day
item.description: On this episode of #WhiskyWednesdays we’re celebrating extraordinary dads and amazing whiskeys. Join Flavien and his guests, @JohnnyDrinks and Irish distiller, Eva O’Doherty as they open up three bottles of Method and Madness, an Irish brand led by experimentation and restless curiosity.

item.title: Whisky Wednesdays: Espolon Tequila Takeover
item.description: Ivy Mix hosts this #whiskyWednesdays Tequila Takeover with friend and mixologist Alex Valencia. Together they try Espolón’s new cristalino and mix up some festive Espolón cocktails just in time for the holidays.

item.title: Wid About Whisky: Stranahan's
item.description: Join host Carrie Keagan as she travels to Denver to visit Stranahan’s Whiskey Distillery. There she’ll sample some great American whiskies, learn the ins and outs of the distillation process “Stranahan's style” and explore Denver’s great outdoors.

item.title: Wid About Whisky: Jeffersons
item.description: Carrie Keagan is back for another wild ride. This time, she’s in Louisville, Kentucky to visit Jefferson’s Distillery and partake in the local flair with Jefferson’s Founder, Trey Zoeller.

item.title: Wine Uncorked: Zetta
item.description: Join comedian-turned-sommelier Patrick Ney and fellow wine lover, Cedric the Entertainer as they explore the Napa Valley and visit some of the most renowed and unique wineries in the region, including Chateau Montelena, Stag’s Leap Wine Cellars, Schramsberg, Chappellet and newcomer, RD Winery.

item.title: Women's Whiskey Revolution: Bourbon Women Siposium
item.description: In this series, Bourbon Women's grand dame Peggy Noe Stevens explores the female-led movement within the whiskey world in conversation with fellow industry powerhouses.

item.title: Tom Colicchio's The Pantry: Liev Schreiber
item.description: Actor and director Liev Schreiber inspires Tom Colicchio with the flavors of his Irish Whiskey, Sláinte. Tom uses it to elevate a classic dish, while the two masters of their craft discuss the parallels between the art of cooking and performance.
